revised_title: Heat-Contraction in Skeletal Muscle: A Study of Proteins and Temperature Effects
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on frog and mammalian muscles to study the effects of heat-contraction and temperature on muscle length. They discovered that heat-contraction is caused by the heat-coagulation of different proteins in the muscle tissue. The study provides insights into the mechanisms of muscle contraction and the role of proteins in the process.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
